prefix_walkthrough:
!!! Here is a walkthrough of a text game:

==>STEP NUM: 0
==>ACT: Init
==>OBSERVATION: Welcome to Adventure!

Murdac
An adventure game by Jonathan R. Partington (Cambridge University, 1982)
[This translation: version 1.111115 / Phoenix v1.04 / Inform v6.32
Please type "inform" for further details.]

Welcome to the Land of Murdac. This is version 1.07.

Type HELP for basic information, and BLURB for the full story.
All comments to JRP1 please. New commands BRIEF/TERSE,
NORMAL/STANDARD, VERBOSE and EXAMINE have now been added.
You are standing outside the door of a small flint hut.
There are paths off to the east, west and south.
The door is locked


==>STEP NUM: 1
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a garden of luxurious flowers. There are paths to
the north, east and south


==>STEP NUM: 2
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a rock garden. There are paths to the east, southeast
and south


==>STEP NUM: 3
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a garden of exotic vegetables. There are paths to the
north, east and south


==>STEP NUM: 4
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: The south-north path ends at a nearly-completed brick wall.
There is a still a gap through which you can pass.
Two ogres here are busily engaged in building activities.
They take no notice of you


==>STEP NUM: 5
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: The ogres finish the wall behind you, cutting off your retreat.
You are in a long north-south alley that runs between two
extremely high sheer walls.
The way south is blocked by a newly-completed brick wall


==>STEP NUM: 6
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: You are at the north end of the alley. It is impossible to
proceed further as there is a very high wall to the north.
There is an antique shawm here


==>STEP NUM: 7
==>ACT: take shawm
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 8
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the alley.
The way south is blocked by a newly-completed brick wall


==>STEP NUM: 9
==>ACT: blow shawm
==>OBSERVATION: WHAAAAAAHHHHEEE!!!
There is a sudden gust of wind and the wall to your south comes
tumbling down with a mighty crash


==>STEP NUM: 10
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are on a north-south path which passes through the ruins of
a brick wall into the garden


==>STEP NUM: 11
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the vegetable garden


==>STEP NUM: 12
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a shrubbery. There are paths to the north and east.
There is a long plank here


==>STEP NUM: 13
==>ACT: take plank
==>OBSERVATION: Under the plank you find a thin metal rod.
OK


==>STEP NUM: 14
==>ACT: take rod
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 15
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the garden at the remnants of a bonfire. There are
paths to the north, west and northwest.
There is a large iron key here


==>STEP NUM: 16
==>ACT: take key
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 17
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the flower garden


==>STEP NUM: 18
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are standing outside the house.
The door is locked


==>STEP NUM: 19
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: You are at an old, untended grave. The tombstone is worn but
you can make out some of the writing on it. There are paths
to the east and north


==>STEP NUM: 20
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a small well-maintained sandpit. The only way out
is to the south


==>STEP NUM: 21
==>ACT: dig
==>OBSERVATION: You dig a small hole in the sand and are rewarded by the discovery of
a brass lamp. However the lamp is off and there appears to be no means
of switching it on


==>STEP NUM: 22
==>ACT: take lamp
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 23
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are at the old grave


==>STEP NUM: 24
==>ACT: read grave
==>OBSERVATION: The stone is worn but you can just make out the name "ARAC"
and the words "... SUSPECTED ... WEREWOLF ...


==>STEP NUM: 25
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are standing outside the house.
The door is locked


==>STEP NUM: 26
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are at the edge of a large, perfectly calm lake. No breeze
ruffles its untroubled waters. There is a path back to the west


==>STEP NUM: 27
==>ACT: howl arac
==>OBSERVATION: O.K. "arac!"
The waters in the centre of the lake part and a hand and arm appear,
grasping a gleaming sword (surprisingly, not at all rusty!) The Lady
of the Lake, if that is who it is, flings the sword towards you so
that it lands at your feet. The hand then disappears, and the waters
regain their calm.
There is a gleaming sword here, whose mighty blade bears the proud
name of Greydeath


==>STEP NUM: 28
==>ACT: take sword
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 29
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: You are standing outside the house.
The door is locked


==>STEP NUM: 30
==>ACT: unlock door
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 31
==>ACT: open door
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 32
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: You are inside the hut. A stone staircase leads into an abyss.
The door is open


==>STEP NUM: 33
==>ACT: close door
==>OBSERVATION: OK.
Your lamp has just switched itself on


==>STEP NUM: 34
==>ACT: lock door
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 35
==>ACT: drop key
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 36
==>ACT: down
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a large quadrangular cellar. There is a flight of stairs
up in the centre and passages in various directions


==>STEP NUM: 37
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the mad scientist's laboratory, which is a large room
with exits to the east and west. Most of the apparatus is
safely stored where you can't get at it, but there is a bed in the
centre on which is lying a huge inanimate human body (or a mixture of
several) with electrodes fastened to various parts of its anatomy.
There seems to be no way of activating the corpse


==>STEP NUM: 38
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a high tunnel to the west of the laboratory. Further
west the floor is covered with a complicated tangle of wires


==>STEP NUM: 39
==>ACT: throw plank
==>OBSERVATION: You throw the plank so as to lie across the wiring


==>STEP NUM: 40
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: You are standing on a wooden plank which is resting on
some wires in an east-west tunnel


==>STEP NUM: 41
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a high east-west tunnel with an alcove off to the
north. To the east the floor is covered by a complicated
network of wires.
There is a plank lying across the wires


==>STEP NUM: 42
==>ACT: take plank
==>OBSERVATION: You succeed (with a certain amount of difficulty) in pulling
the plank across and picking it up


==>STEP NUM: 43
==>ACT: throw rod
==>OBSERVATION: There is a loud crackling sound as the rod comes into contact
with the live wires and completes an electrical circuit. At
the same time you hear sounds from the laboratory as though
something might be stirring


==>STEP NUM: 44
==>ACT: throw plank
==>OBSERVATION: You throw the plank so as to lie across the wiring.
The corpse, now reanimated, lurches out onto the plank a second
or two later


==>STEP NUM: 45
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: You see the Monster of Murdac as it strides along the corridor
past the alcove. You then hear a mighty crash as it walks straight
through the western wall.
You are in a small alcove to the north of the high tunnel


==>STEP NUM: 46
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the east-west tunnel by the alcove, with the wiring
to your east.
There is a plank lying across the wires


==>STEP NUM: 47
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a high east-west tunnel. The monster has opened a
path to the west through what was formerly a solid wall


==>STEP NUM: 48
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a secret cavern with newly-created passages, the
size of a large human being, to the east and west. There is
also a low crawl to the south.
There is an ornately fashioned bowl of solid gold here


==>STEP NUM: 49
==>ACT: take bowl
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 50
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a low damp chamber whose walls are covered in noxious
slime. The only exit is a low crawl north.
A loathsome toad is crawling about here


==>STEP NUM: 51
==>ACT: take toad
==>OBSERVATION: To your surprise the toad speaks. "Spare me!" it says "And I will
give you a precious jewel, which will save you from many torments."

Do you still want to pick the toad up?


==>STEP NUM: 52
==>ACT: no
==>OBSERVATION: "Thank you" says the toad. "May this stone serve you well." It crawls
into a little hole somewhere and fetches out a small object which
it deposits at your feet before crawling away again


==>STEP NUM: 53
==>ACT: take stone
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 54
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the secret cavern


==>STEP NUM: 55
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are in a high east-west tunnel. The monster has opened a
path to the west through what was formerly a solid wall


==>STEP NUM: 56
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the east-west tunnel by the alcove, with the wiring
to your east.
There is a plank lying across the wires


==>STEP NUM: 57
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are standing on a wooden plank which is resting on
some wires in an east-west tunnel


==>STEP NUM: 58
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the tunnel between the laboratory and the wiring.
There is a plank lying across the wires


==>STEP NUM: 59
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the laboratory.
There is a pillow on the bed


==>STEP NUM: 60
==>ACT: take pillow
==>OBSERVATION: OK


==>STEP NUM: 61
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the cellar


==>STEP NUM: 62
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are at a complicated junction of passages: an east-west
passage crosses another corridor, which enters from the
northeast and tilts so as to leave in a downwards direction


==>STEP NUM: 63
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: You are in the entrance hall to what appears to be a haunted house.
The air is filled with sounds of wailing, screeching and bumping.
There are archways to the east and west


==>STEP NUM: 64
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: A large item of furniture flies across the room, hurled by
a poltergeist. With the aid of the pillow you fend it off,
and it narrowly misses your face.
You are in a large bedroom in the haunted house.
There are exits to the north, south, east and west


==>STEP NUM: 65
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: A large item of furniture flies across the room, hurled by
a poltergeist. With the aid of the pillow you fend it off,
and it narrowly misses your face.
You are in a small bedroom in the haunted house.
There are exits to the north, south, east and west


==>STEP NUM: 66
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: A large item of furniture flies across the room, hurled by
a poltergeist. With the aid of the pillow you fend it off,
and it narrowly misses your face.
You are in the billiard room of the haunted house.
There are exits to the north, south, east and west


==>STEP NUM: 67
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: A large item of furniture flies across the room, hurled by
a poltergeist. With the aid of the pillow you fend it off,
and it narrowly misses your face.
You are in the pantry of the haunted house.
There are exits to the north, south, east and west


==>STEP NUM: 68
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: A large item of furniture flies across the room, hurled by
a poltergeist. With the aid of the pillow you fend it off,
slightly bruising your right arm.
You are in the study of the haunted house.
There are exits to the north, south, east and west


==>STEP NUM: 69
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: A large item of furniture flies across the room, hurled by
a poltergeist. With the aid of the pillow you fend it off,
and it narrowly misses your face.
You are in the kitchen of the haunted house.
There are exits to the north, south, east and west


==>STEP NUM: 70
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: A large item of furniture flies across the room, hurled by
a poltergeist. With the aid of the pillow you fend it off,
and it narrowly misses your face.
You are in the living-room (!) of the haunted house.
There are exits to the north, south, east and west
